templates.mailtemp: Your ticket cannot be processed as we are missing infomation. Please update your ticket with the relevant information.
I cannot reach you on your mobile/cubic phone. Please contact me when you become available.

In order to resize your area, it must be moved to a different disk This can be done overnight, but you must not write to your disk during this procedure. The next day, you should open all setup sessions that you had. Please let me know if tonight is a good time for this.
templates.closetemp: Done!
Fixed!

I've extended your STOD for XXXXX days but since it was going to expire today, you MUST run this command TODAY in order to complete the extension: XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
Next time please request an extension at least 3 days before expiry.
Added you to the unix group. Please notice it takes up to 1 hour to update, and that you'll need to start a new session in order for it to take effect (by running ssh `hostname`)
Hi, We do not handle this type of issue, please open a service request to CMCC for this ticket.
templates.mailtemp: Hi, I tried to add you to the group, but you already belong to 16 groups, which is the Unix limit. Please remove yourself from groups by running "gm" on idc-login machine and follow the interactive menu. Let me know once you are done and I will add you to the group.

Hi, Your personal details, including cubic/mobile phone numbers are not updated in the coorporate phonebook. To help us support you in the future, we would appreciate if you could update your details: 1. Go to Intel home. 2. Click 'Corp. Phonebook', on the right. 2. Search for yourself, in the format: lastName, firstName. 3. Click on your name link in the result table. 4. Click on the 'Update details' button on the upper right corner.
Thank-you for helping us help you!
templates.closetemp:
In order to get an account in FM, submit a service request (http://servicedesk.intel.com/sdcxuser/intel/user/userrrnstart.asp?txtLink=RequestsUser) to Region: AMR, Site: FM - Folsom, Building: FM1 - Folsom 1.
In order to get mpgall and gsrall Unix groups in FM, please fill the form on http://dbcenter.iil.intel.com/DynamicForms.aspx?form=unix_permissions_request_allsites&project=mmg Make sure to choose "fm" in the "Group Domain".

In order to get an account in SC, submit a service request (http://servicedesk.intel.com/sdcxuser/intel/user/userrrnstart.asp?txtLink=RequestsUser) to Region: AMR, Site: MI - Mission, Santa Clara , Building: SC12 - Santa Clara 12.
In order to get mpgall and gsrall Unix groups in SC, please fill the form on http://dbcenter.iil.intel.com/DynamicForms.aspx?form=unix_permissions_request_allsites&project=mmg Make sure to choose "sc" in the "Group Domain".

Hi,
These groups are not owned by us, so we can't add you to it. You should ask it from HSW IP request.
You should file a request here: https://hsdhsw.intel.com/HSD/HASWELL/default.aspx#access_request/default.aspx
In order to get cpu1270, select ip_domain 'process', and ip_access_method 'unix' In order to get nhm/nhmdb, select ip_domain 'sch_lay_db' , and ip_access_method 'unix'

In order to be added to sklall UNIX group, please fill a request at the below web page:
https://hsdskl.iil.intel.com/hsd/skylake/default.aspx#access_request/default.aspx?ldudef=1
Once your request will be approved by the project manager, you will be automatically added to that group.

In order to be added to gsrall UNIX group, please fill a request at the below web page:
http://dbcenter.iil.intel.com/DynamicForms.aspx?form=unix_permissions_request_allsites & project=mmg
Once your request will be approved by the project manager, you will be automatically added to that group.

In order to be added to mpgall UNIX group, please fill a request at the below web page:
http://dbcenter.iil.intel.com/DynamicForms.aspx?form=unix_permissions_request_allsites & project=mmg
Once your request will be approved by the project manager, you will be automatically added to that group.

In order to be added to mpgall UNIX group, please fill a request at the below web page:
http://dbcenter.iil.intel.com/DynamicForms.aspx?form=unix_permissions_request_allsites & project=mmg
Once your request will be approved by the project manager, you will be automatically added to that group.

In order to be added to mpgdsgn UNIX group, please fill a request at the below web page:
http://dbcenter.iil.intel.com/DynamicForms.aspx?form=unix_permissions_request_allsites & project=mmg
Once your request will be approved by the project manager, you will be automatically added to that group.

templates.mailtemp: GSR Cheat Sheet: firefox /p/gsr/rtl/proj_bin/setup/gsr_cheat_sheet.html
We are missing information, please send us the details below as soon as possible.
This issue should be solved in person. Please contact me in my cubic.
templates.closetemp: GSR Cheat Sheet: firefox /p/gsr/rtl/proj_bin/setup/gsr_cheat_sheet.html
Your issue has been resolved. If there are any further problems, please contact me.
This issue should be handled solved by CMCC, Please submit a GEMS ticket at http://servicedesk.intel.com
Please read the known solution in the URL below:

For these UNIX groups - please fill out the relevant web-based form: gsr_rtl http://www-iec.iil.intel.com/IPRequest/RequestForm.aspx?ProjectID=242 gsrall http://www-iec.iil.intel.com/IPRequest/RequestForm.aspx?ProjectID=243 nhm http://www-iec.iil.intel.com/IPRequest/RequestForm.aspx?ProjectID=233
You were added to a new CSD pool: XXXXX (Group: AVL) Please allow 15 minutes before using machines from this pool.

Hi, You should have an account with your username as the initial CATS password. Please invoke CATS application by running: 'cats' (under setup) At first invocation you'll be asked to change your password to a more secure one (8 characters, letters, numbers, special, etc.).
Note that you won't need to remember CATS password and it will be un-encrypted in ~/.cats/.cats.passwd.
You were added to the new UNIX group, as requested. You will see new groups only on new logins, For changes to apply on all xterms, it is recommended to restart your VNC session when possible.

Please use this form to submit your request:
http://dbcenter.iil.intel.com/DynamicForms.aspx?form=unix_permissions_request_allsites&project=mmg
In case you have problems accessing the site you can submit the request from UNIX prompt like this:
adgm --request-group-access -A <username> -G gsr_rtl -s iil --justification '<a detailed justification which includes a contact in SNB IDC>'

templates.mailtemp: I cannot reach you on your mobile/cubic phone. Please contact me when you become available.
This issue belongs to the iMPV (AVL) team. I will forward your ticket to their team, but next time please open it directly to them.
templates.closetemp: Done!
templates.mailtemp:
(In order to define a certain Hier in the RTL to be a Fub, we use the blocks info list file. This is actually a list of Hiers in the RTL that are considered to be BE Fubs.)
Usage: Defining a certain HIER in the RTL to be a Fub, or, deleting certain Hier which is a Fub (so it can be further partitioned in to smaller Fubs) What to do: Working with a private list, below is a cheat-sheet on how to do that: (Currently, the central blocks info list resides in a central area and used during your RTLbuild flow).
1. Find what is your model's version of Blocks_Info: >> grep -A 1 "blocks_info" $MODEL_ROOT/cfg/RTLToolData.pm Find your version under the key VERSION => "<your version>" that will appear in the UNIX shell
2. Copy the Blocks_Info to your private area: >> cp -r $PROJ_TOOLS/blocks_info/<your version> <your_place>
3. Remove/Add the name of your FUB by editing the file: >> gvim <your place>/<your version>/gsrcore/fubs_blocks_info.csv or >> gvim <your place>/<your version>/gsr4cg/fubs_blocks_info.csv
4. Create tool *patch* file under your $MODEL_ROOT/ >> gvim $MODEL_ROOT/<model name>.patch and copy the next line to it: $ToolConfig_tools{hier}{SUB_TOOLS}{blocks_info}{PATH} = "<your_place>/<your version>";
5. setenv TOOLCONFIG_OVERRIDE: >> setenv TOOLCONFIG_OVERRIDE $MODEL_ROOT/<model name>.patch
6. Remove the old target area of the synthesis run (if exist) and recompile the model: >> rm -rf $MODEL_ROOT/target/part_<model>* >> simbuild -dut <your dut> -s pcmake -s ucmake -syn +.
templates.closetemp:
(In order to define a certain Hier in the RTL to be a Fub, we use the blocks info list file. This is actually a list of Hiers in the RTL that are considered to be BE Fubs.)
Usage: Defining a certain HIER in the RTL to be a Fub, or, deleting certain Hier which is a Fub (so it can be further partitioned in to smaller Fubs) What to do: Working with a private list, below is a cheat-sheet on how to do that: (Currently, the central blocks info list resides in a central area and used during your RTLbuild flow).
1. Find what is your model's version of Blocks_Info: >> grep -A 1 "blocks_info" $MODEL_ROOT/cfg/RTLToolData.pm Find your version under the key VERSION => "<your version>" that will appear in the UNIX shell
2. Copy the Blocks_Info to your private area: >> cp -r $PROJ_TOOLS/blocks_info/<your version> <your_place>
3. Remove/Add the name of your FUB by editing the file: >> gvim <your place>/<your version>/gsrcore/fubs_blocks_info.csv or >> gvim <your place>/<your version>/gsr4cg/fubs_blocks_info.csv
4. Create tool *patch* file under your $MODEL_ROOT/ >> gvim $MODEL_ROOT/<model name>.patch and copy the next line to it: $ToolConfig_tools{hier}{SUB_TOOLS}{blocks_info}{PATH} = "<your_place>/<your version>";
5. setenv TOOLCONFIG_OVERRIDE: >> setenv TOOLCONFIG_OVERRIDE $MODEL_ROOT/<model name>.patch
6. Remove the old target area of the synthesis run (if exist) and recompile the model: >> rm -rf $MODEL_ROOT/target/part_<model>* >> simbuild -dut <your dut> -s pcmake -s ucmake -syn +.
templates.mailtemp:
Intro: Each RTL element (always blocks, generate blocks, assign, instance of module and ect.) that is tagged with a partition tag will be removed from the original parent module and be relocated to a new partition model with the name that is specified as the value of the partition tag The new created partitioned modules will be created in the file <partitioned module name>.vs RTL elements (module items that can have partition tags applied to them) that were not tagged by any partition tag will be relocated to a default partition, by default the new partitioned module name will be <parent module name>_default. GSR eRTL methodology forbids "_default" partitions and crashes the RTL Netlist flow on such violation.
What to do: 1. Let's find what logic was considered as "default": find $MODEL_ROOT/target/part_<your_dut>_nlapp/post_nlapp -name "*_default.vs" 2. Let's go over each and every file found and talk to RTL owner in order to debug the issue.
I cannot reach you on your mobile/cubic phone. Please contact me when you become available.
This issue belongs to the iMPV (AVL) team. I will forward your ticket to their team, but next time please open it directly to them.
templates.closetemp: Done!
